mauto.description:
AutoField (mauto).

An IntegerField that automatically increments according to available IDs.

mbigauto.description:
BigAutoField (mbigauto).

[New in Django 1.10.]

A 64-bit integer, much like an AutoField.

mbigint.description:
BigIntegerField (mbigint).

A 64-bit integer, much like an IntegerField.

mbinary.description:
BinaryField (mbinary).

A field to store raw binary data.

mcoseint.description:
CommaSeparatedIntegerField (mcoseint).

This field is deprecated since 1.9 in favor of CharField with validators.

mdate.description:
DateField (mdate).

A date, represented in Python by a datetime.date instance.

mdatetime.description:
DateTimeField (mdatetime).

A date, represented in Python by a datetime.datetime instance.

mdecimal.description:
DecimalField (mdecimal).

A fixed-precision decimal number, represented in Python by a Decimal instance.

mduration.description:
DurationField (mduration).

A field for storing periods of time - modeled in Python by timedelta.

memail.description:
EmailField (memail).

A CharField that checks that the value is a valid email address.

mfilepath.description:
FilePathField (mfilepath).

A CharField whose choices are limited to the filenames in a certain directory on the filesystem.

mfloat.description:
FloatField (mfloat).

A floating-point number represented in Python by a float instance.

fk.description:
ForeignKey (fk).

A many-to-one relationship.

on_delete will become a required argument in Django 2.0. In older versions it defaults to CASCADE.

mip.description:
IPAddressField (mip).

This field has been deprecated since version 1.7 in favor of GenericIPAddressField.

mimg.description:
ImageField (mimg).

Inherits all attributes and methods from FileField, but also validates that the uploaded object is a valid image.

mint.description:
IntegerField (mint).

An integer. Values from -2147483648 to 2147483647 are safe in all databases supported by Django.

mgenericip.description:
GenericIPAddressField (mimg).

An IPv4 or IPv6 address, in string format.

mnullbool.description:
NullBooleanField (mnullbool).

Like a BooleanField, but allows NULL as one of the options.

o2o.description:
OneToOneField (o2o).

A one-to-one relationship.

on_delete will become a required argument in Django 2.0. In older versions it defaults to CASCADE.

mposint.description:
PositiveIntegerField (mposint).

Like an IntegerField, but must be either positive or zero (0).

mpossmallint.description:
PositiveSmallIntegerField (mpossmallint).

Like a PositiveIntegerField, but only allows values under a certain (database-dependent) point.

mslug.description:
SlugField (mslug).

A slug is a short label for something, containing only letters, numbers, underscores or hyphens. They’re generally used in URLs.

msmallint.description:
SmallIntegerField (msmallint).

Like an IntegerField, but only allows values under a certain (database-dependent) point.

mtime.description:
TimeField (mtime).

A time, represented in Python by a datetime.time instance.

murl.description:
URLField (murl).

A CharField for a URL.

muuid.description:
UUIDField (muuid).

A field for storing universally unique identifiers. Uses Python’s UUID class.

mxml.description:
XMLField (mxml).

*All uses of XMLField can be replaced with TextField. This field has been deprecated since version 1.3*

mstore.description:
HStoreField (mstore).

*PostgreSQL specific model fields*.

A field for storing key-value pairs. The Python data type used is a dict.

mjson.description:
JSONField (mjson).

*PostgreSQL specific model fields*.

[New in Django 1.11.]

A field for storing JSON encoded data.

marray.description:
ArrayField (marray).

*PostgreSQL specific model fields*.

A field for storing lists of data
